name: HD 95127
scenarioDescription:
The HD 95127 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 95127 is a star with 3.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 41.01 times its radius. It is located 2249.66 light years away from the solar system.

HD 95127 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 95127 system


HD 95127 b

HD 95127 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.28 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 95127 b is 3380.34 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 95127 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 95127, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
